meanings.definition: To perform the action of slubbing or making uneven.
meanings.sent1: She slubbers the clay to create a textured surface.
meanings.sent2: The tailor accidentally slubbers the hem of the dress.
meanings.sent3: The chef slubbers the cake frosting, giving it a unique look.
meanings.sent4: The artist slubbers the paint on purpose for a rough effect.
meanings.sent5: The gardener slubbers the soil to add depth to the garden beds.

meanings.definition: A person who slubbers or makes uneven.
meanings.sent1: The slubbers left a trail of uneven marks in the sand.
meanings.sent2: The new apprentice was known as the slubbers in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous slubbers always made a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The old painter was a true slubbers, creating abstract masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The young slubbers showed potential in pottery class with their unique style.

meanings.definition: The act of slubbing or making uneven.
meanings.sent1: The slubbers of the fabric gave it a rustic appearance.
meanings.sent2: The constant slubbers in the road made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy's slubbers in the mud caused laughter in the family.
meanings.sent4: The slubbers of the river created a soothing sound as it flowed.
meanings.sent5: The natural slubbers in the wood added character to the handmade furniture.
